Beyond their acclaimed brews, Upland is also renowned for its delectable burgers and tenderloins.  Anticipating a similarly impressive culinary experience with their pizza, I recently ventured to sample their offerings.  However, my Margherita pizza fell short of expectations.  The crust, reminiscent of a cracker, lacked substance, and the overall pizza was rather light.  While the cheese was satisfactory, the other toppings failed to contribute any notable flavor. Notably absent was the traditional red sauce, a defining characteristic of an authentic Margherita pizza.  In my estimation, while Upland's pizza could serve as a palatable appetizer for a group, I would recommend opting for their renowned burgers or tenderloins as a main course during future visits.

I was torn between 3 and 4 stars for this Naked Tchopstix location. Having loved the 96th Street branch, I was eager to try this one closer to home. While both offer a similar menu, the atmosphere here is more takeaway-focused, although they do have a sizable dining area. 

Ordering is done at the counter, and your food is delivered to your table. My daughter and I opted for the sushi bowl, which offers a customizable experience.  We loved that you select your proteins, vegetables, rice, and toppings on a paper sheet, eliminating any guesswork or shouting across the counter.

The sushi bowl was enjoyable but not exceptional.  The vegetable choices felt somewhat limited, and I found the bowl to be rice-heavy. However, the sauces were delicious. My husband ordered the Maui roll, his favorite from the 96th Street location, but it didn't quite live up to the standard set there. It was still good, but the quality and consistency were lacking.

Despite these minor drawbacks, I would definitely return, especially for the sushi bowls. I wanted to address the negative reviews regarding service. Let's be realistic, it's a sushi restaurant, not a fast-food joint! Expect a slightly slower pace; you won't be in and out in five minutes, even though it's called "Express." As a healthier fast-casual option in the area, the wait is well worth it.

Finally, don't miss the bubble tea! I had the strawberry flavor, and it was delightful. Next time, I'm going to try the vanilla chai.

Instead of a warm welcome, we received a reluctant "I guess it would be fine" and a hurried retreat. Throughout the evening, his behavior remained distant and unwelcoming, leaving us with a sense of being inconvenienced.

The situation escalated when we requested to split the bill due to company policy. This simple request was met with an air of annoyance, further compounding our negative experience. 

Determined to give the restaurant another chance, we returned the following night, ensuring that the problematic waiter was not on duty. This time, a friendly and engaging bartender named Ben completely redeemed the establishment. He was attentive, knowledgeable, and genuinely interested in creating a positive experience. Ben's professionalism and charisma were a stark contrast to our previous encounter, showcasing the difference a dedicated staff member can make. 

Furthermore, I ordered room service from the restaurant on my final night and was impressed by the quality of the food. The bacon-wrapped dates and chocolate cake were exceptionally delicious.

In conclusion, while one negative encounter overshadowed the initial impression, the exceptional service from Ben and the delicious room service left a lasting positive impression.  The restaurant possesses great potential, and it is unfortunate that a single individual's attitude nearly ruined the overall experience.

Knowing the restaurant is popular, we put our name in and enjoyed a drink nearby while we waited for approximately 45 minutes. We were then seated at the bar, where we were warmly greeted by Keith, the bartender.  Keith was friendly, knowledgeable about his whiskey selection, and created a truly enjoyable atmosphere.

We began our meal with three Cape May Salts (two for me, one for my son) and an order of tater tots, both of which exceeded our expectations.  For dinner, I opted for the Kentucky Fried Quail, which was outstanding (though I found the succotash to be less impressive).  My son chose the $24 Foie Gras burger, and it was truly incredible – worth every cent! 

While the duckfat fries were delicious, they weren't the highlight of the meal. I personally preferred them without the cheese sauce, which was thankfully offered on the side.  

Overall, this is a restaurant I highly recommend and can't wait to return to with all my friends and family. 


This restaurant was absolutely fantastic!  From the moment I read about their duckfat french fries, I knew I had to try it.  I took my son there for his birthday, and even though we had a 45-minute wait, it was worth it. 

We enjoyed a drink at a nearby bar while we waited, and were then seated at the bar. Our bartender, Keith, was incredibly friendly and knowledgeable about whiskeys.  We started with three Cape May salts (two for me and one for my son) and some tater tots, which were both delicious.

For dinner, I ordered the Kentucky Fried Quail, which was absolutely amazing, although I wasn't as impressed with the succotash. My son chose the pricey $24 Fois Gras burger, but he declared it incredible and said it was worth every penny.  While the duckfat fries were good, they weren't even the best part of our meal.  I could have done without the cheese sauce, but since it was served on the side, it didn't ruin our experience.  

I can't wait to return to this restaurant and share it with everyone I know!

After approximately 45 minutes, we were seated at the bar. Keith, our bartender, was incredibly welcoming and knowledgeable about his whiskey selection, making for a delightful experience.

We began with three Cape May Salts (two for me and one for my son) and a portion of tater tots, both of which exceeded our expectations. For dinner, I opted for the Kentucky Fried Quail, which was exceptional, although I found the succotash to be somewhat underwhelming. My son chose the highly-acclaimed $24 Foie Gras burger, and it truly lived up to the hype.  Every penny was worth it!

While the duckfat fries were delicious, they weren't the highlight of the meal. I personally preferred them without the cheese sauce, although the fact that it was served on the side allowed me to customize my experience.  I am eager to return to this exceptional restaurant with all my friends and family.

For my fiancé's birthday, we were craving Thai food. He wanted something casual, so we turned to Yelp, which led us to Jasmine Rice. It proved to be a great choice!

We initially had our eye on the summer rolls, but alas, they weren't available until the summer season.  Instead, we opted for the pan-fried dumplings, which were tasty but probably won't be a repeat order.

We shared the green curry fried rice with duck and chicken pad thai. Both dishes were delicious, but the duck stole the show – it was truly some of the best duck I've ever tasted.  

While the pad thai was good, it was a touch too sweet for our preference, so next time we'll explore a different noodle dish.  Adding a dash of chili sauce definitely helped brighten it up.

Our service was pleasant, but we did notice some other diners had less favorable experiences. One table, rushing to a show at the Kimmel Center, faced a long wait for their food, risking being late.  Another customer who ordered take-out was missing an item, but the owner went above and beyond, calling the customer and personally delivering the missing dish to their home.

Overall, Jasmine Rice offers high-quality Thai cuisine. We definitely plan to return!

While we were hoping for summer rolls, we learned they wouldn't be available until the season changed, so we opted for pan-fried dumplings as a starter. Though tasty, they weren't memorable enough for us to order again.  

The main courses were a highlight. The green curry fried rice with duck and chicken pad thai both impressed, but the duck truly stole the show. It was some of the most delicious duck I've ever tasted.  

We found the pad thai a touch too sweet to our liking, so we'll explore other noodle options on our next visit. However, it was still very enjoyable, especially with a dash of chili sauce.

Service was generally good, but we noticed some inconsistencies. One table, rushing to a show at the Kimmel Center, faced a significant delay in their meal, potentially jeopardizing their plans. Additionally, a takeout customer experienced a missing item, which the owner promptly rectified by personally delivering the missing dish to the customer's home.

Overall, Jasmine Rice offers high-quality Thai cuisine. We would definitely return to savor more of their flavorful dishes.

A word of warning: this place is petite, so reservations are highly recommended. Be prepared for a wait, especially during peak hours. Luckily, our wait was a mere 20 minutes as the dinner rush subsided.

The daily special, a tantalizing $25 for 3 lbs of California Rock Crab, salad, and a choice of soup or chowder, proved irresistible. Witnessing trays of succulent rock crab being served solidified our decision.

The salad and soup/chowder combo were generous and delicious, setting the stage for the main event. While the chowder was delightful, my wife's Shrimp Bisque stole the show – a must-try for any seafood enthusiast.

But the star of the evening was undoubtedly the rock crab.  Each juicy, buttery chunk of white meat was a revelation, requiring only a few cracks to reveal its treasures. From the delectable sides to the unparalleled crab, our meal was a symphony of flavors and textures. The rock crab special offered exceptional value, making it a standout experience on our trip.

Last year, my friends and I embarked on a girls' trip to New Orleans, choosing The Saint as our accommodation. The hotel's lobby was charming, and the bar and restaurant boasted a stylish ambiance that drew admiration.  I was already impressed by the hotel's usual amenities - a sophisticated yet comfortable atmosphere, friendly staff, and a sense of playful luxury.  

I checked in early, eager to tackle some work before my friend's arrival. I settled into my room, ordered room service, and focused on my tasks for a solid four hours. After wrapping up my work, I ventured out to pick up a bottle of wine and enjoy a manicure and pedicure.

My friend arrived, and we were ready to fully embrace the vibrant energy of New Orleans.  We indulged in a delicious dinner, returned to the hotel giggling, and that's when we encountered our first, and biggest, problem: a gigantic cockroach, brazenly flying across the room. I was horrified!  I immediately left the room and rushed to the front desk, terrified by the possibility of more lurking in the shadows. 

The staff assured me they would dispatch a maintenance worker, but I was unconvinced. I knew this was not a solitary pest; its boldness suggested a larger infestation. They offered us a different room, but their solution was unacceptable. The new room, they said, wouldn't be ready until 8 am. To our dismay, the new room wasn't any better. It had small spiders, dead insects in the corners, a malfunctioning TV, and even a lamp without light bulbs!

By 3 am, I was exhausted and deeply unsettled. I knew I wouldn't be staying past 8:15 am.  The thought of leaving my belongings in such a condition was simply unbearable.  I quickly booked us a room at The W, my usual go-to hotel,  for the rest of our trip.

Despite our frustration, we waited until 8 am to see if a manager would address our concerns. No one came to our room, so I went down to demand an audience. A young man approached us, apologized, and offered a refund. I accepted his apology and politely requested a full refund. He agreed and even asked us to consider returning after the necessary changes were made.  However, I politely declined. After this experience, I knew I wouldn't be back.

Due to a flight diversion to Tampa, we decided to extend our trip and drive to Orlando. Before hitting the road, we were in search of a meal and wanted to discover a local eatery rather than a chain restaurant. Yelp led us to this hidden gem.

The ladies in our group opted for the 7 oz. Tampa strip steak, while the gentlemen chose the 14 oz. ribeye.  The steaks were grilled over oak and citrus wood, imparting a smoky flavor that was truly exceptional. As avid smokers ourselves, we appreciate the distinctive taste achieved by wood-fired cooking.  Finding steaks prepared this way is uncommon, so this dining experience was a delightful surprise.

Our sides consisted of vegetables and sweet potatoes. We were impressed by the wine selection, which offered a range of decent wines at reasonable prices, most under $20 a bottle. Unlike many restaurants that inflate wine prices, this establishment kept them fair.

Our waitress, Lisa, provided excellent service, offering helpful recommendations and creating a welcoming and friendly atmosphere. We were delighted that we chose a local restaurant over a chain. This place is definitely going on our list for a return visit during our next trip to Tampa.

As avid home grillers who use our smoker to achieve a similar wood-smoked taste, we were thrilled to discover a restaurant that shared our passion. We were immensely glad that we chose this local gem over a chain restaurant.  This place is definitely worth bookmarking for a return visit next time we're in Tampa.

My journey with Trust Me BBQ has been a long and disappointing one. I first attempted to visit over a year ago, but left after a 10-minute wait with no service. Despite reading positive reviews, I decided to give them another chance to understand the hype. Unfortunately, my second attempt was equally frustrating. 

The food was a mixed bag, with some dishes hitting the mark and others falling flat. While the BBQ sauce was delicious and the macaroni salad offered a unique twist, the pulled pork was moist and flavorful. However, the chicken was incredibly dry, bordering on inedible even with the generous sauce. The macaroni and cheese seemed to have been sitting on the steam table for days, and the collard greens lacked any significant flavor.

The biggest downfall of Trust Me BBQ, however, was the abysmal service. The cashier remained silent, expressionless, and completely disengaged. It felt more like ordering from a vending machine than interacting with a human being.  To add insult to injury, he didn't even listen to our order, resulting in incorrect sides being served. We had to correct him mid-transaction. 

Overall, the combination of mediocre food and dreadful service has left me with no desire to return. I'll stick with Down to the Bone BBQ for my future BBQ fix.

Despite positive online reviews, my experience at this establishment was disappointing. Their website, lacking clear menu information, offered only brief descriptions of their offerings without prices.  It took some digging to find the menu, requiring me to select a location and scroll to the bottom. The table placecard provided more detailed descriptions than the website. Upon entering, I found the atmosphere more akin to a bar than a restaurant, though tables were available.  Unable to decide, I opted for the roast beef and roast pork combos, priced at $6.85 each.

Service was quick, but the temperature of the sandwiches was inconsistent. The roast beef arrived cold while the roast pork was hot, raising concerns about proper food handling.  I requested the roast beef be reheated, and while it was warmer, it remained noticeably colder than the freshly served roast pork.  The waitress offered to replace it, but I declined due to time constraints.

The sandwiches were meager in meat portions but compensated with an excessive amount of gravy, making them overly messy. The bread was also crumbling. The menu placecard mentioned a "wet meat" option with less gravy, which I strongly advise considering, as the gravy overpowered both the meat and the structural integrity of the sandwich. 

Overall, the experience was underwhelming, falling short of expectations based on the positive reviews.

The sandwiches themselves were incredibly skimpy on meat, but the generous amount of gravy poured over them created an overly messy and structurally compromised experience. The bread disintegrated under the weight of the gravy. 

The menu place card mentions a "wet meat" option, which reduces the amount of gravy. I highly recommend choosing this option, especially if the goal is to prevent the gravy from overwhelming the meat and ruining the integrity of the sandwich.
